page.title: 15CLUBS IN TRELAWNYD
page.content: The Trelawnyd Brownies were formed in l97l and meet weekly at the school. The pack is one of eight in the Prestatyn district which is part of the Rhuddlan Division of Clwyd Girl Guides. The Brownies all live in the villages of Trelawnyd and Trelogan. The small rural pack place the emphasis on activities out in the countryside. They go for nature walks and picnics. They also have a small garden in the school grounds which they cultivate and grow plants and flowers from seed. Cooking and Handicraft plays a large part in their Winter programme. Occasionally they travel to prestatyn where they join in activities with other Brownies and Guides of the district.
